edu.nyu.cs.javagit.api.commands

Class GitStatusOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.nyu.cs.javagit.api.commands.GitStatusOptions

  • public final class GitStatusOptions
extends java.lang.Object
    A class for managing options and passing these options to <git-status> command. The <git-status> command takes the same set of options as <git-commit> it shows what would be committed if the same options are given to git-commit.

      • isOptAll

        public boolean isOptAll()
        optAll tells the command to automatically stage files that have been modified and deleted, but new files you have not told git about are not affected. Returns true if all(-a) option need to be used for <git-status> command.
        Returns:
        value of optAll

      • setOptAll

        public void setOptAll(boolean all)
        Sets the '-a' options to <git-status> command. If any one of the optOnly or OptInclude options are set then optAll should not be set. While setting optAll to true, if optOnly or optInclude is set set then IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        all -

      • isOptInclude

        public boolean isOptInclude()
        Before making a commit out of staged contents so far, stage the contents of paths given on the command line as well. This is normally not used. Returns true if include(-i) option is set for <git-status> command.
        Returns:
        optInclude

      • setOptInclude

        public void setOptInclude(boolean include)
        Sets the value of optInclude to <git-status> command.
        Parameters:
        include -

      • isOptOnly

        public boolean isOptOnly()
        Returns true if only(-o) option is set.
        Returns:
        optOnly

      • setOptOnly

        public void setOptOnly(boolean only)
        Sets the optOnly option for <git-status> command. optOnly should not be set if optAll(-a) option is set. IllegalArgumentException is thrown if both '-a' and 'o' are set.
        Parameters:
        only -

      • isOptNoVerify

      • isOptAllowEmpty

        public boolean isOptAllowEmpty()
        Returns true if allow empty options is set. This option should be set if it's okay to record an empty change.
        Returns:
        True if allow empty options is set. This option should be set if it's okay to record an empty change.

      • setOptAllowEmpty

        allowEmpty -

      • getAuthor

        public java.lang.String getAuthor()
        Returns the author. This option should be used if we would like to override the value in commit.
        Returns:
        author
